channel.title: [317] PI - Tried a few things but didn't work in need of help!
channel.description: I know this sounds stupid i was wondering how to change this --> http://gyazo.com/5f0d6134ef5c1a3d9537745c743c0a11 because its points, where i want it as coins! if any one can help me that would be great :)

item.title: [317] PI - Tried a few things but didn't work in need of help!
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

If you aren’t really looking for an answer that would have you modifying things that you don’t understand yet you could change the shops id as the one specified is currently used as some point shop.

Read full topic

item.title: [317] PI - Tried a few things but didn't work in need of help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

ShopAssistant.java
You should have a method called
buyFromShopPrice

It should have stuff like:

else if (c.myShopId == 7390 && c.myShopClient != null && c.myShopClient.playerName.equals(c.playerName)) { c.sendMessage(c.getItems().getItemName(removeId) + ": currently costs " + c.playerShopP[removeSlot] + " points."); return; }

However, I do agree with IfearI.

Read full topic
item.source: [317] PI - Tried a few things but didn't work in need of help!

item.title: [317] PI - Tried a few things but didn't work in need of help!
item.dc:creator: @IfearI IfearI
item.description:
@IfearI wrote:

Have you tried searching in your project for the words “currently costs”?
When they send the message you could use an if-statement to distinguish between coins and another type of currency.

(A more OOP way to generalize would be to use a Currency enum/class and handle the currency instead of an if)

Read full topic
